channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A non-Archimedean Arens--Eells isometric embedding theorem on valued fields
item.description: arXiv:2309.06704v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In 1959, Arens and Eells proved that every metric space can be isometrically embedded into a normed linear space as a closed subset. In later years, in the paper on a short proof of the Arens--Eells theorem, Michael implicitly pointed out that the Arens--Eells theorem follows from the statement that every metric space can be isometrically embedded into a normed linear space as a linearly independent subset. In this paper, we prove a non-Archimedean analogue of the Arens--Eells isometric embedding theorem, which states that for every non-Archimedean valued field $K$, every ultrametric space can be isometrically embedded into a non-Archimedean valued field that is a valued field extension of $K$ such that the image of the embedding is algebraically independent over $K$.
item.dc:creator: Yoshito Ishiki

item.title: Invariant random subgroups on certain orbits
item.description: arXiv:2506.09723v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $G$ be a connected Lie group and $\text{Sub}_G$ be the space of closed subgroups of $G$ equipped with the Chabauty topology. In this article, we investigate the existence of invariant random subgroups of $G$ supported on various orbits of the conjugation action of $G$ on $\text{Sub}_G$.
item.dc:creator: Manoj Choudhuri, C. R. E. Raja
